Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
logic.character.Enemy
Direct Known Subclasses:
Berserker, Boss, Mage, Shaman, Slime, SlimeKing, Warrior
public abstract class Enemy extends Object
Base abstract class representing any enemy in the game.

An Enemy maintains its combat-related stats, including health, maximum health, attack power, and various status conditions. Concrete subclasses must implement the attack(Player) method to define specific combat behavior.

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(int health, int attack)
      Constructs a new Enemy with the specified initial health and attack.

      Initialization:

      • Health set to the given value (minimum 0)
      • Max health set equal to initial health
      • Attack power set to given value
      • Freeze status = false
      • Debuff status = false
      • Poison counter = 0
      • Enemy type defaults to EnemyType.NORMAL
      Parameters:
      health - initial health value
      attack - initial attack power

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public EnemyType getType()
      Returns the enemy's classification type.
      Returns:
      the EnemyType assigned to this enemy

    • setType

      public void setType(EnemyType type)
      Sets the classification type for this enemy.
      Parameters:
      type - an enum value describing the enemy category

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Returns the enemy's current health.
      Returns:
      current health value

    • setHealth

      public void setHealth(int health)
      Sets the enemy’s health. Values below 0 are clamped to 0.
      Parameters:
      health - new health value

    • isFreeze

      public Boolean isFreeze()
      Returns whether the enemy is currently frozen.

      Being frozen may prevent the enemy from acting, depending on combat logic.

      Returns:
      true if frozen; otherwise false

    • setFreeze

      public void setFreeze(Boolean freeze)
      Sets the frozen status of the enemy.
      Parameters:
      freeze - true to freeze the enemy; false to unfreeze

    • isDebuff

      public Boolean isDebuff()
      Returns whether this enemy is currently under a debuff effect.
      Returns:
      true if debuffed; otherwise false

    • setDebuff

      public void setDebuff(Boolean debuff)
      Sets the debuff status of the enemy.
      Parameters:
      debuff - true to apply a debuff; false to clear it

    • getPoison

      public int getPoison()
      Returns the poison counter value applied to this enemy.

      The meaning (e.g., damage per turn) depends on combat system rules.

      Returns:
      poison value

    • setPoison

      public void setPoison(int poison)
      Sets the poison counter for this enemy.
      Parameters:
      poison - new poison amount

    • getAttack

      public int getAttack()
      Returns the enemy's attack power.
      Returns:
      attack value

    • setAttack

      public void setAttack(int attack)
      Sets the enemy's attack power. Values below zero are clamped to zero.
      Parameters:
      attack - new attack value

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      Returns the maximum health this enemy can have.
      Returns:
      max health value

    • setMaxHealth

      public void setMaxHealth(int maxHealth)
      Sets the enemy's maximum health.

      This does not automatically change the current health.

      Parameters:
      maxHealth - new maximum health value

    • attack

      public abstract void attack(Player p)
      Performs this enemy's attack behavior against the specified player.

      Each concrete enemy type (e.g., Mage, Shaman, SlimeKing) provides its own implementation of damage formulas, status effects, and attack selection.

      Parameters:
      p - the player being targeted
